instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2337: What is A2337? A2337 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Late 2020 M1 with EMC 3598, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-02016..
definitions.820-02016: What is 820-02016? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
got this with 5.12v 0.12amp stable
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_AON</SIGNAL> 12.29v stable
<SIGNAL>PP3V8_AON_VDDMAIN</SIGNAL> .2v not shorted
on my thermal cam <CHIP>U5340</CHIP> is overheating around 50 degree celsius nothing short in this area
i replaced <CHIP>U5340</CHIP>, <CHIP>U5200</CHIP>, <CHIP>U5700</CHIP>, <CHIP>U8100</CHIP> and both uf4/500 still the same <CHIP>U5340</CHIP> still overheating.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U5340</CHIP> voltages.
Check diode mode to ground around <CHIP>U5700</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
<CHIP>U5340</CHIP> voltages
pin:
2 1.7v
4 0v not shorted
5 5v

<CHIP>U5700</CHIP> diode mode
only pin:16 (<SIGNAL>P3V8AON_VRTN</SIGNAL>) having fullshort but i compared it
to working board also fullshort so this is normal i guess.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-02016</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2337</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> no power
threads.message:
Replace <CHIP>U5340</CHIP> again.
Just for test, remove it and solder <RESISTOR>R5341</RESISTOR>.
